intro: Thlaspi watsonii, commonly known as Watson's cabbages, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species of mustard and cabbages. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually basal, pinnately divided, and covered in fine hairs. Thlaspi watsonii is adapted to harsh climates and plays a role in stabilizing soils in its native habitats.
